intro: Petalostigma quadriloculare var. genuina, commonly known as the four-chambered petalostigma, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring four distinct chambers within the perianth. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
